title: 20 ELLE-Approved Must-Haves From Sephora’s Spring Sale

html:
Sol de Janeiro Delícia Drench Body Butter

Treat your skin to this intensely moisturizing body butter, which Beauty Commerce Editor Nerisha Penrose credits with rescuing her dry winter skin.

Merit Signature Lip Lightweight Matte Lipstick

If you love a matte lip, look no further than Merit. The brand’s newest lipstick launched last year and earned high marks in our editors’ tests for staying put throughout the day.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Hourglass Unreal Liquid Blush

A little goes a long way with this pigmented blush (Beauty Assistant Tasha Nicole Smith recommends a single dot for your whole face) that’s designed to be buildable.

Amika Blowout Babe Thermal Round Brush

Skip the trip to the salon with an at-home blowout, courtesy of this heated round brush. It has an ergonomic handle and, perhaps most importantly, a nine-foot cord to reach all of your hair. “A few passes with the brush, and my frizz is gone, roots are lifted, and my strands appear sleek and shiny,” Associate Beauty Commerce Writer Carol Lee says.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Sephora Collection The Starter Brush Set

Whether your brush collection needs a full makeover or you’re looking to build it out with a few specialty brushes, Beauty Director Kathleen Hou recommends this comprehensive set. The kit comes with six brushes for face and eyes (plus a useful pouch for storage and travel).

Summer Fridays Lip Butter Balm

This viral lip balm is soothing and hydrating and comes in an array of scented sheens that team ELLE loves. Choose the vanilla-beige version for a slightly tinted sheer color that smells oh so sweet.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Saie Slip Tint Radiant All-Over Concealer

Saie’s hyaluronic acid-based formula keeps this concealer hydrating, so it shouldn't cake. It’s an editor-favorite for covering up dark circles, too.

Summer Fridays Jet Lag Mask

Anyone with spring travel booked should buy this handy tube for a post-flight pick-me-up. “This mask is a lifesaver that wakes the skin up and infuses it with moisture,” says Alexis Bennett Parker, ELLE commerce content lead.

Ole Henriksen Banana Bright Vitamin C Serum

A vitamin C serum can work wonders for dull, tired skin. This one, packed with antioxidants, can be dabbed on alone or mixed with your moisturizer.

Ami Colé Hydrating Lip Treatment

If you love the sheer color of a gloss, but not the stickiness of the formula, opt for this hydrating little tube. It comes in a range of colors (the nude shade is another favorite of Smith’s), but this berry is perfect for spring.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Laneige Lip Sleeping Mask

This ultra-hydrating lip mask is a best-seller for a reason: It’s thick without leaving residue and enriched with shea butter for extra softness. Beauty Editor Katie Berohn calls it her “desert island product.”

Phlur Missing Person Eau de Parfum

On the hunt for a fresh perfume for spring? Call off the search—the answer is Phlur’s Missing Person, which has a warm bergamot scent.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Supergoop! Protec(tint) Daily Skin Tint SPF 50

Somehow both lightweight and protective (with an advertised four hours of coverage), Supergoop!’s ELLE-loved tinted SPF will quickly become part of your daily routine.

Innisfree Jumbo Daily Broad Spectrum SPF

While you’re at it, stock up on regular sunscreen, too. This Korean SPF has a water-based formula that’s made to be gentle on the skin.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Nécessaire The Body Wash Eucalyptus

In terms of little luxuries, you really can’t beat a deliciously scented body wash. Berohn recommends this one (“I would honestly be more than happy only using Nécessaire’s body wash for the rest of my life,” she says), which smells like eucalyptus and includes vitamins C and E to nourish your skin.

Fable & Mane SahaScalp Amla Soothing Serum

This editor-recommended rosemary hair oil (dubbed a "luxe treat") includes aloe in its formula to soothe your scalp while promoting hair growth.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Dieux Forever Eye Mask

Dieux’s soft silicone patches are some of our favorite under-eye masks. Because they’re reusable, you can cut down on single-use products.

Iris & Romeo Lash Up Peptide Mascara

Here’s a mascara that can do it all, from volumizing to lengthening. It’s another favorite of Lee’s: “The formula makes my lashes look like falsies, rarely ends up on my under-eyes, and washes off with just water and a little bit of regular facial cleanser.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Make Up For Ever Skin Blush & Glow Longwear Cream Face Palette

Looking for a do-it-all palette that has you covered for blush and highlighter? Penrose recommends this 12-pan one, which she says is great for mixing and matching.

Dr. Dennis Gross Skincare Advanced Retinol + Ferulic Perfectly Dosed Retinol Treatments

These overnight peeling pads target dark spots, wrinkles, and fine lines with the help of retinol and ferulic acid. Per Penrose, a weekly use of these could help your skin look more refreshed.
